excerpts: Some favorites include - chicken tikka masala, chana dal, and sag paneer.
Began Bertha is pretty good too
but sometimes it's more saucy than substance.
chana dal.author: jamie m.
chana dal.review: Love this place! We order delivery all the time. It's quick, the price is right, and the food is delish! Some favorites include - chicken tikka masala, chana dal, and sag paneer. Began Bertha is pretty good too but sometimes it's more saucy than substance.

excerpts: We ordered Chicken Biryani ($12.99), Goat Curry ($13.99), Mutter Paneer ($10.99), and Basmati Rice ($1.99).
Mutter Paneer - The peas were cooked to perfection.
They were not too soft or too hard.
There was a decent amount of paneer cubes.
mutter paneer.author: Kristina M.
mutter paneer.review:
My boyfriend felt like a celebrity for 3 minutes when the server asked if he has been to this restaurant before. This was actually our first and most likely not our last time eating at this restaurant. 

We ordered Chicken Biryani ($12.99), Goat Curry ($13.99), Mutter Paneer ($10.99), and Basmati Rice ($1.99). Each of the dishes was pretty good. 

Chicken Biryani - We requested this dish to be a little spicy. It was very flavorful and had a lot of spices in it. It tasted as good as what the pictures looked like on Yelp. 

Goat Curry - My boyfriend thought this dish was very spicy and flavorful. The sauce was thick and the meat was tender and fell right off the bones in a good way. He said he will goat back. 

Mutter Paneer - The peas were cooked to perfection. They were not too soft or too hard. There was a decent amount of paneer cubes. I asked for mild and I was glad the dish still had some flavor. 

You should definitely go to this place if you are in the area.

excerpts: - My friend got the Mutter Paneer which was a lot better, but a little to spicy for my taste.
- The waiters were very friendly but kind of forgot about us after the place got really busy (hence the -1 star).
mutter paneer.author: Kameron K.
mutter paneer.review:
Didn't this place used to be a porn shop before Urban Curry came in?

Anyways, came in with a group of friends on a rainy day when we were looking for dinner.  After being turned away from 2 restraunts that gave us an 1.5 hour wait because we didn't have reservations, I remembered that Urban curry just opened not that long ago and I was craving indian food over Italian.

Came in, the place was kind of empty but filled up pretty fast after we came in. 

- Got the Paneer Tikka Masla .  It was alright, but not spicy at all and a little disappointing.
- The naan was awesome, fresh and yummy
- The chai came free with the meal, but wasn't expecting much.  It tasted like hot milk with a little chai flavor in it.
- My friend got the Mutter Paneer which was a lot better, but a little to spicy for my taste.
- The waiters were very friendly but kind of forgot about us after the place got really busy (hence the -1 star).  Had to go out of our way to get their attention for them to clear our table and get the check.

Pretty cheap and lots of vegetarian options.  Lots of seating and good for larger groups.

Left urban curry with a pretty good feeling and yummy paneer in my tummy.  I'd def recommend and come back again.

excerpts: My favorite is chicken coconut with their garlic naan.
I highly recommend everybody try it.
chicken coconut.author: Xu-Chen W.
chicken coconut.review: This is a really good restaurant with indian curry and delicious naan. My favorite is chicken coconut with their garlic naan. I highly recommend everybody try it.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken biryani and lamb jalfraizee.
It wasn't oily or strangely colored.
The rice was excellent and all the ingredients tasted like they were good quality.
lamb jalfraizee.author: Kira G.
lamb jalfraizee.review:
Ordered through Grub Hub. 

Food arrived hot and delicious. I ordered a chicken biryani and lamb jalfraizee. It wasn't oily or strangely colored. The rice was excellent and all the ingredients tasted like they were good quality.

excerpts: I had the chicken karahi and samosas.
Nothing taste like it should.
The inside of the samosa is soggy and it doesn't taste like meat.
It taste like mush and smells weird.
The chicken karahi has so much oil on the top.
I don't taste any spices.
No ginger, no particular flavor I can even recognize.
chicken karahi.author: Kristal R.
chicken karahi.review:
Awful. I had the chicken karahi and samosas. Nothing taste like it should. The inside of the samosa is soggy and it doesn't taste like meat. It taste like mush and smells weird. The chicken karahi has so much oil on the top. I don't taste any spices. No ginger, no particular flavor I can even recognize. I really wish I can get my money back....

I'm not a picky person. I'm not even had to please when comes to food because I'll eat anything. This is the worst Indian food I have ever had. I don't think it's authentically made. I wish I could give it zero stars. The positive reviews shock me.

excerpts: Tried the chicken karahi, garlic naan, rice, Mango lassi.
Meh overall.
Asked for medium spicy - was just "spicy hot" without any flavour.
Questionable hygiene too.
Will skip next time.
chicken karahi.author: Vighnesh R.
chicken karahi.review:
Tried the chicken karahi, garlic naan, rice, Mango lassi. 
Meh overall. Asked for medium spicy - was just "spicy hot" without any flavour.
Questionable hygiene too. Will skip next time.

excerpts: Chicken Karahi with green peppers is awesome.
I tried chicken karahi a couple of times and always found it true to its roots.
This a genuine Pakistani restaurant.
chicken karahi.author: Shahey R.
chicken karahi.review:
Nihari if you are a beef fan. Chicken Karahi with green peppers is awesome.  Mon amore loves and recommends chicken biryani.

I tried chicken karahi a couple of times and always found it true to its roots. This a genuine Pakistani restaurant.

excerpts:
Picked 4 things for a delivery order:

Achari chicken
Palak paneer
Chicken karahi
Plain naan
chicken karahi.author: Vandana N.
chicken karahi.review:
Picked 4 things for a delivery order:

Achari chicken
Palak paneer
Chicken karahi
Plain naan

All were good - maybe not as good as Pakwan or some other places in the city, but definitely hit the spot on a lazy evening calling for food delivery.

Food was delivered within the time specified.  Having the option to order online is awesome.

excerpts: I had the Chicken Karahi, which was okay
but I'm not a fan of dark meat chicken
so I wouldn't get it again.
That being said, it was good.
chicken karahi.author: Kara M.
chicken karahi.review:
My fiancé and I went to a happy hour nearby and decided to try Urban Curry for dinner rather than deal with traffic & parking to go to Little Delhi. Despite the mixed reviews we figured we'd give it at least one chance. My fiancé is Indian so he's usually the determining factor on whether or not we return to an Indian restaurant. I had the Chicken Karahi, which was okay but I'm not a fan of dark meat chicken so I wouldn't get it again. That being said, it was good. Very tomato-y and spicier than I expected.

My fiancé had the Chicken Boti and gave it an 8 out of 10. We also had the Palak Paneer, which he gave a 7 and I gave an 8. I like mine less on the creamy side (more healthy)...he likes the spinach to be 'saucy' so he was a bit disappointed. 

We both agreed the naan was a bust. It was undercooked and tasted more like pizza dough, which made me wonder if they actually have a Tandoor oven at all.

The complimentary chai was good but the papadum was much like the naan and needed to be baked longer. The place itself is clean and nicer than I expected. 

If I were in North Beach and wanted Indian food I might come back but I prefer Little Delhi hands down.

excerpts: I've especially enjoyed the flavor-packed Chicken Karahi paired with your more mellow Bainghan Bartha.
chicken karahi.author: Cathy K.
chicken karahi.review:
Urban Curry, you caught my eye the first time I strolled past you amongst the flashing lights on Broadway.

I've visited you 3 times so far and you have not disappointed. I appreciate your genuine hospitality and inviting dining room with 'solid' tables and chairs, dressed with nice glassware and China. 

Your food is delicious! I appreciate the variety of  Indian + Pakistani cuisine you offer. I've especially enjoyed the flavor-packed Chicken Karahi paired with your more mellow Bainghan Bartha. Your fresh out of the oven naan is a delight.

I must return soon. Thank you!

excerpts: We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Karahi and Garlic Naan.
Can't say anything bad about their food, service or the atmosphere of this place.
We weren't quite familiar with Indian food, so I asked the waiter for recommendations and he had suggested the Chicken Karahi, which was delicious - just the right amount of spice.
The Tikka Masala was so mellow and
as for the Garlic Naan - it was the best I've ever tasted, seriously.
Definitely worth your visit and easy 5 stars here.
chicken karahi.author: Kahanalei M.
chicken karahi.review:
Without a doubt, my friend and I agreed:  This was the best Indian food we tried. We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Karahi and Garlic Naan.  Can't say anything bad about their food, service or the atmosphere of this place.  It was a little confusing trying to locate exactly where this place was on Broadway, but if you're coming from Market St area, going north on Columbus, then it's to your right, where Columbus and Broadway intersect.  

When we got here on a Sunday evening, my friend honestly was a bit weary since no other customers were here, but after trying their food, any worries he had went out the door.  We were wondering why there weren't more customers in here, since their food was awesome, but on the other hand, since it was quiet, it created for a relaxed and chill moment in time, to really concentrate on our food;-)  

We weren't quite familiar with Indian food, so I asked the waiter for recommendations and he had suggested the Chicken Karahi, which was delicious - just the right amount of spice.  The Tikka Masala was so mellow and as for the Garlic Naan - it was the best I've ever tasted, seriously.  Definitely worth your visit and easy 5 stars here.

excerpts: There is nothing like super duper tasty chicken karahi, some garlic naan, dhal channa, and  biryani to warm the belly and give you the recharge you need to head back out into the nasty weather.
chicken karahi.author: Peanut S.
chicken karahi.review:
Stumbled out of the rain and into Urban Curry on a stormy Saturday afternoon. There is nothing like super duper tasty chicken karahi, some garlic naan, dhal channa, and  biryani to warm the belly and give you the recharge you need to head back out into the nasty weather. 

in particular, i really enjoyed the service & the ambiance... 

enjoy your 5-stars Urban Curry... I hope more and more people start enjoying your karahi like I did.

excerpts: Just tried their Chicken Karahi and it was soooooo good....
The best I've eaten in the whole of San Francisco.....
This restaurant beats any other India rest.
hands down...just no competition whatsoever....
Their Chef is authentic and the food is as good as you can get in India or Pak.....just the best....5 stars without a doubt...:)
chicken karahi.author: Nilesh J.
chicken karahi.review: Just tried their Chicken Karahi and it was soooooo good....The best I've eaten in the whole of San Francisco.....This restaurant beats any other India rest. hands down...just no competition whatsoever....Their Chef is authentic and the food is as good as you can get in India or Pak.....just the best....5 stars without a doubt...:)

excerpts: Chicken Karahi!!!!
That was some good Indian food.
Nice atmosphere.
Helpful wait staff..
what more can you ask for.
Decided to by pass Chicken Tikka Masala for once and try something new.
Went for the Chicken Karahi, Aloo ghobi, rice and garlic naan for two people.
Perfect amount of food for two good eaters.
Can't wait to go back and eat there  again!
chicken karahi.author: B. C.
chicken karahi.review: Chicken Karahi!!!!! That was some good Indian food. Nice atmosphere. Helpful wait staff.. what more can you ask for. Decided to by pass Chicken Tikka Masala for once and try something new. Went for the Chicken Karahi, Aloo ghobi, rice and garlic naan for two people. Perfect amount of food for two good eaters. Can't wait to go back and eat there  again!

excerpts: Our dishes were the vegetable biryani (I'm still waiting on the vegetables.. but plenty of rice) and the chicken karahi.
Both dishes were over the top spicy, almost inedible.
The naan was very bland and had almost none of the characteristic oven flavor you expect from naan.
I would probably try this place again if I was in the neighborhood, but I would not go out of my way.
chicken karahi.author: jen w.
chicken karahi.review: I didn't think this restaurant was very good. I eat Indian food several times a week, I love it, so I think I'm a fair judge. First off we found the waiter to be extremely condescending, which put us on edge. Our dishes were the vegetable biryani (I'm still waiting on the vegetables.. but plenty of rice) and the chicken karahi. Both dishes were over the top spicy, almost inedible. The naan was very bland and had almost none of the characteristic oven flavor you expect from naan. I would probably try this place again if I was in the neighborhood, but I would not go out of my way.

excerpts: Had the Chicken Karahi and thought it was an exceptional dish, very flavorful and went great with Garlic Naan.
The Karahi is a boneless chicken sauteed with tomatoes, herbs and spices in a traditional pan.
chicken karahi.author: Daniel T.
chicken karahi.review: Had the Chicken Karahi and thought it was an exceptional dish, very flavorful and went great with Garlic Naan.  The Karahi is a boneless chicken sauteed with tomatoes, herbs and spices in a traditional pan.

excerpts: Great Chicken tika masala, awesome chicken karahi and the garlic naan is delicious.
The staff provides awesome service and is always friendly.
Your also able to bring in your own beer!
chicken karahi.author: Greg L.
chicken karahi.review: Urban Curry is my favorite Indian place around. I go nearly every week. Great Chicken tika masala, awesome chicken karahi and the garlic naan is delicious. The staff provides awesome service and is always friendly. Your also able to bring in your own beer!

excerpts: It did have a little kick to it, so I decided to go back and try something else: Chicken Karahi.
I REALLY liked it, and again I didn't even have to ask for them to make it spicy.
The restaurant itself is a nice and tastefully designed (so in a way it's out of place being so close to "Garden of Eden
" et.
al.), and the staff are very friendly.
I'll be back!
chicken karahi.author: Ed F.
chicken karahi.review: I went twice and had an experience similar to that of other yelpers.  For my first trip I had Biriyani.  No offense to the people of Pakistan, but I think Indians make it better.  It did have a little kick to it, so I decided to go back and try something else: Chicken Karahi.  I REALLY liked it, and again I didn't even have to ask for them to make it spicy.  The restaurant itself is a nice and tastefully designed (so in a way it's out of place being so close to "Garden of Eden" et. al.), and the staff are very friendly.  I'll be back!

excerpts: We ordered the samosas, garlic naan, onion naan, paneer naan, chicken tikki masala, and the fish karahi.
Everything was delicious but my favorites were definitely the garlic naan and fish karahi.
We definitely cleaned the pot that the fish karahi came in...
the sauce was so yummy!
fish karahi.author: Katelynn L.
fish karahi.review:
Came here with my cousins and sister for lunch today and it was pure yumminess.  We ordered the samosas, garlic naan, onion naan, paneer naan, chicken tikki masala, and the fish karahi.  Everything was delicious but my favorites were definitely the garlic naan and fish karahi.  We definitely cleaned the pot that the fish karahi came in...the sauce was so yummy!  I also had a mango lassi to wash it all down (basically tasted like a mango smoothie but with yogurt instead of ice cream).

Man, that was such a satisfying meal.  To my surprise, I didn't smell like Indian spices when I left, which made it that much better.

Note: We mentioned Yelp and was able to get 15% off (good until January 10th) so definitely go and check it out!  Once again, I owe it to Yelp for helping me find such a great spot (cuz god knows I would've never found Urban Curry on my own, haha) ~  thanks Yelp!

excerpts: The chicken tikka masala is buttery and super spicy (just the way I like it), goat karahi was tendered and not as gamey as I thought it would be and prawn vindaloo was good but not as good as the goat karahi.
Get extra garlic naan!
They even called me to confirm my order.
goat karahi.author: T. T.
goat karahi.review: Fast delivery and delicious! Samosas were huge! 2 is more than enough for 4-6 people. The chicken tikka masala is buttery and super spicy (just the way I like it), goat karahi was tendered and not as gamey as I thought it would be and prawn vindaloo was good but not as good as the goat karahi. Get extra garlic naan! They even called me to confirm my order.

excerpts: the goat karahi was okay.
I forget goat can be very fatty and lot of bones.
The spicey sauces were so tasty.
The food rocks!
I guess they have a late night buffet which I thought about but wouldn't be able to use with the coupon.
The buffet was all-you-can-eat for $10 bucks!!
We left as they were starting to put out a variety of food.
goat karahi.author: Sandra R.
goat karahi.review:
I'm loving Indian food lately and had to come here. Found a coupon from restaurant.com and it's only 2 blocks from the hotel! How have I missed this place before??
The garlic naan is so good and garlicy! The papadum was delicious, lamb vindaloo was spicy and oh so good and the goat karahi was okay. I forget goat can be very fatty and lot of bones. The spicey sauces were so tasty.
The food rocks! I guess they have a late night buffet which I thought about but wouldn't be able to use with the coupon. The buffet was all-you-can-eat for $10 bucks!! We left as they were starting to put out a variety of food. I would like to try that sometime, just to get more variety of the foods.

The web site stresses the service as being good. Well, it wasn't good but it wasn't non-existent either. They could have done a better job; but we also didn't need anything.

The after dinner tea was just right too.

What I can't understand is how people think this food is bland! Do you not have taste buds?? Have they been burned off from too spicy food before?? lol
The food is wonderful and I can't wait to go back sometime.

excerpts: I got the Lamb Karahi the first time with an onion chile salad on the side.
lamb karahi.author: Charlie G.
lamb karahi.review:
I've eaten here on two occasions.  The food is great and the staff very friendly.

It can initially be confusing when you walk in because they sit you down with a menu but then you need to get up and order from the counter when you decid on your meal options.

The silverware, flatware, glasses and water are "self-serve" from an area near the middle of the restaurant.  There are pitchers of water available in a large cold case.

They are relatively attentive to special dietary consideration such as gluten or dairy free.  I got the Lamb Karahi the first time with an onion chile salad on the side.  The next time I had the Lamb Roghan Josh with the same side.  

The food comes out hot (temp) and very flavorful.  One word of CAUTION, they will normally ask you how spicy you want your food...tread lightly.  I ordered the Roghan Josh "medium."  Combined with the, onion chile salad and I was LIT UP!!!  Whew! HA HA! 

I normally try to avoid dairy, but I make it a point to finish a meal here with a Mango Lassi for "dessert."

They also have self-serve hot Chai tea which makes a flavorful after-dinner finisher.

The only reason for 4 stars is the location.  Although, the street and restaurant itself is clean and well-trafficked, it's in an area with "Gentleman's" clubs; one located next door and one across the street.  Of course, this area of San Francisco has a varied mix of business establishments so this really just goes with the territory.

Will definitely be back in Urban Curry whenever I'm in the SFO!

excerpts: The lamb karahi here is incredible.
Try it!
Ate here for dinner..
Service is never awesome at smaller places but the food was amazing and spicy.
lamb karahi.author: Lauren S.
lamb karahi.review:
Rarely do I write a yelp review but def a chow hound. This authentic little gem is worth yelping about.

The lamb karahi here is incredible. Try it!  Ate here for dinner.. Service is never awesome at smaller places but the food was amazing and spicy. Can't wait to go back.

Ps byob and no fees!

excerpts: The highlights of this meal: the lamb karahi and the fact it was delivered.
lamb karahi.author: Miss A.
lamb karahi.review:
It's Sunday night and I was in the mood for some good Indian food.  Found this place on yelp and in the end was not too impressed. I hate to say this but it gets a ......Meh........at best.  The CTM did taste like the reviews had mentioned....tomato soup and the garlic naan was the worst I've ever had.  It seem store bought and just doctored up with garlic butter and throw on a grill top to warm it up.  

The highlights of this meal: the lamb karahi and the fact it was delivered. 

I won't go back :(

excerpts: I've had CTM, bhengan bartha, aloo gobhi, lamb karahi, lamb biryani, with garlic naan and basmati rice over the two dinners there.
The lamb karahi definitely stands out for me.
It's a super flavorful dish, with tender and juicy chunks of lamb.
lamb karahi.author: Naoko M.
lamb karahi.review:
3.5 stars rounded up.

I've been to Urban Curry a couple times and left with a very full belly on both occasions.  

The service here is a bit on the slow side (-1 star) but they are friendly.

I've had CTM, bhengan bartha, aloo gobhi, lamb karahi, lamb biryani, with garlic naan and basmati rice over the two dinners there.

The lamb karahi definitely stands out for me.  It's a super flavorful dish, with tender and juicy chunks of lamb.  This dish makes me want to work my way through their Karahi menu it was so good.

Aloo gobhi was another favorite at my table, since it was nicely spiced but wasn't very heavy to eat.  

The CTM was fine, nothing to write home about, and same with the bhengan bartha.  The BB could have been served hotter, but it had a nice creamy texture which I enjoyed.  The lamb biryani didn't has as much lamb as I had hoped, but I guess that is typical for a rice dish.

I think the food tends to be a tad more on the spicy side here, so don't be surprised.

I live only a few blocks away from here so I'm sure to be back when I get that craving for good Indian food.

excerpts: The Lamb Karahi I had was amazing.
Palak Paneer was great, was least oily paneer I've ever had - loved it.
Chicken Tikka Masala - excellent.
I've had better samosa; it was overly mushy inside, consistency not right.
I'd recommend the Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer but strongly urge you to try the Karahi -it was just superb.
lamb karahi.author: Liz K.
lamb karahi.review:
One word - Karahi.  The Lamb Karahi I had was amazing.  Palak Paneer was great, was least oily paneer I've ever had - loved it.  Chicken Tikka Masala - excellent.  I've had better samosa; it was overly mushy inside, consistency not right.  I'd recommend the Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer but strongly urge you to try the Karahi -it was just superb.  I'm hungry just thinking about it.

Service was good, servers kind.  Recently under new management in last 6 or so weeks.  New owner is personable and dynamic.  Explained how they made the dishes and the origins.  Convinced us to go in and try and we're so glad we did.  Will be one of our regular stops.  They deliver too.  If you're driving, heed the parking sign restrictions.

excerpts: * Lamb Karahi was delicious (albeit a tad salty).
(According to our server, karahi is a signature dish of this restaurant).
Restaurant is clean.
You will leave not smelling like you just left an Indian restaurant.
No ghee overload.
You will not be gulping water by the end of the meal.
Spicy food is spicy food.
You won't be disappointed.
Prices are reasonable.
lamb karahi.author: Rob T.
lamb karahi.review:
Nothing to dislike (not even being surrounded on all sides by seedy strip clubs):

* Lamb Karahi was delicious (albeit a tad salty). (According to our server, karahi is a signature dish of this restaurant).
* Restaurant is clean. You will leave not smelling like you just left an Indian restaurant.
* No ghee overload. You will not be gulping water by the end of the meal.
* Spicy food is spicy food. You won't be disappointed.
* Prices are reasonable. And a lunch party of 6 doesn't automatically incur a gratuitous gratuity.

Picky people should note that the chicken dishes are in general dark meat, except for the chicken tikka masala and perhaps one or two other dishes.

excerpts: Lamb karahi, okra, chicken tikka masala, veggie biriyani and garlic naan.
I would definitely go the karahi and veggie biriyani again.
You know an ethinc restaurant is legit when people of that nationality are eating there and this is such a place!
lamb karahi.author: Jessica H.
lamb karahi.review: Delicious and cheap eats. Love the BYOB. I love indian food any time of day but particularly for lunch if I'm hungover or for late night eats. This place has a buffet on Friday and Saturday nights til 3am (or some crazy hour). How ridiculous is that! I had never had karahi before but learned about it being a signature pakistani dish. Since we had the scoutmob deal we went to town and feasted. Lamb karahi, okra, chicken tikka masala, veggie biriyani and garlic naan. I would definitely go the karahi and veggie biriyani again.  You know an ethinc restaurant is legit when people of that nationality are eating there and this is such a place!

excerpts: The Lamb Karahi was quite good, i've never had it before but thaks to the yelpers before me on the recommendation.
The chai tea and naan were also good.
Now i'm a Chicken Tikka Masala slut...for real
i'm back home and eating some now
and i've gotta say their is super meh.
Like most store based sauces it is very tomato based.
That aside, great service and a nice yelp check in special.
Just remember, don't ever go full retard and don't go for the CTM here.
lamb karahi.author: David P.
lamb karahi.review: 3.5 stars. If you've got urban in your name you really need an in house rapper...that aside I did have some good food. The Lamb Karahi was quite good, i've never had it before but thaks to the yelpers before me on the recommendation. The chai tea and naan were also good. Now i'm a Chicken Tikka Masala slut...for real i'm back home and eating some now and i've gotta say their is super meh. Like most store based sauces it is very tomato based. That aside, great service and a nice yelp check in special. Just remember, don't ever go full retard and don't go for the CTM here.

excerpts: The Lamb Karahi was fantastic (and a recommendation from my server!).
I tried the Chicken Tikka Masala, and it wasn't worth purchasing.
Definitely get some Naan, and you'll have a great meal.
lamb karahi.author: Ryan G.
lamb karahi.review: I enjoyed my meal and experience at Urban Curry on a quiet Tuesday night. The Lamb Karahi was fantastic (and a recommendation from my server!). I tried the Chicken Tikka Masala, and it wasn't worth purchasing. Definitely get some Naan, and you'll have a great meal.

excerpts: Lamb Karahi.
Now this one was an adventure.
Why?
Because I was so ecstatic about the place and food, I totally forgot to ask them to make it mild.
When the dish came, I looked at it, and the waiter, thinking "I'm fried!"
He told me to try and see if it's too spicy.
I did.
It was tasty, and painfully HOT!
I told him I would work around it.
During the entire dinner, he was so concerned that he came over a few times to make sure I was OK.
I was NOT OK, but to tell you, NO REGRETS!
I was drowning the meat in yogurt to neutralize the spice.
I wanted to eat it.
lamb karahi.author: Cordeon H.
lamb karahi.review:
Karen was nice enough to take me out to dinner and let me choose where to eat. She's vegetarian and I like lamb. There's no better choice than going to an Indian restaurant. I found Urban Curry from Yelp, where I go if I want to try something different. Going down the list I could see mostly 4-5 stars and hey, how could you go wrong? So Urban Curry it is.

We were standing at the door at 5PM, waiting for it to open. Walked in, impressed right away. It's clean, very clean. I work in a clinic. Cleanliness and hygiene is my main thing. Since we were the only patrons there, we got all the attention. The staff was warm and courteous. Right off the bat, complimentary Chai tea. Nice. Very nice. 

Karen had the eggplant. She couldn't stop praising the taste.

I ordered: 
Fish Pakora for appetizer. The batter was just right, not doughy at all and the fish was fresh and tender.

Lamb Karahi. Now this one was an adventure. Why? Because I was so ecstatic about the place and food, I totally forgot to ask them to make it mild. When the dish came, I looked at it, and the waiter, thinking "I'm fried!" He told me to try and see if it's too spicy. I did. It was tasty, and painfully HOT! I told him I would work around it. During the entire dinner, he was so concerned that he came over a few times to make sure I was OK. I was NOT OK, but to tell you, NO REGRETS! I was drowning the meat in yogurt to neutralize the spice. I wanted to eat it. It was so damn good.

The Naan was to die for. It was fluffy on top, and crispy at the bottom. I brought some naan home but totally forgot about it for a few days. Pulled it from the fridge, stuck it in the toaster oven and it was just as good as new.

I had tears running the entire time but it's all worth it. I'm definitely coming back and bringing my friends too. The food is delicious and the price is right, and not forgetting the 15% off if you mention Yelp. As long as I write a reminder on my hand to order everything mild, I'm good to go!

excerpts:
Lamb Karahi
-
lamb karahi.author: Eric O.
lamb karahi.review:
I was reluctant to try this place, until I saw the Yelp reviews.  I've since been there several times and have yet to be disappointed.  First, of all, the place is clean and spacious.  The service is always friendly and attentive and the food is very worth-while.  So far, I've tried and can recommend the following:

- Chicken Tikka-Masala
- Lamb Karahi
- Lamb Boti
- Garlic Naan

If you can't tolerate spice in your food, it's best to make that known.  On some dishes, you'll be asked to specify the level of spiciness.  With Indian owners and Mexican line chefs, "medium" is pretty spicy.

Last time I was in, they offered a 15% discount if you mentioned Yelp.  I don't know if this discount is still available.  However, even undiscounted, the food is very reasonable.

The only reason that this place doesn't get 5 stars is the location.  The place is located in the heart of the Broadway/Kearny/Columbus triangle, so if you go on a Friday or Saturday night, you'll have to wade through all the bridge-and-tunnel riff-raff that invariably collects there.  I've limited my visits to weeknights for just that reason.

Good, cheap food and friendly service will keep me coming back.  Highly recommended.

excerpts: Ordered their Signature dish, Lamb Karahi (?).
It came in a wok and was spicy and delish.
Chai and rice were good and hot, but the Garlic Naan was just a bit much.
Waiter was attentive and knowledgeable.
Service was quick.
lamb karahi.author: Bev M.
lamb karahi.review: Ordered their Signature dish, Lamb Karahi (?). It came in a wok and was spicy and delish. Chai and rice were good and hot, but the Garlic Naan was just a bit much. Waiter was attentive and knowledgeable. Service was quick.

excerpts: Chicken Tikka for him, a Lamb Karahi and the Spinach w/ home made Cheese (palak paneer) for me.
The staff could not have been nicer.
They told us to be seated at a table while we waited and sincerely offered to bring us waters.
The man who took our order was very specific when inquiring about our tolerances for heat and the cooks delivered a level that was perfect for us.
I'll admit that to me the Tikka tasted a bit like a sweet tomato soup, but my husband was over the moon with it
and it's his regular dish.
i was thrilled with my Lamb dish, and it only tasted better when i revisited my left overs two days later.
The flavors had continued to develop while it sat in my fridge.
My whole wheat roti was perfect, perfect.
it was freshly made and had bubbly, crispy parts in it.
My man likes the Paratha, which i find a bit oily
but he LOVED it.
Mostly, we're really excited to have good indian food in the neighborhood.
They don't deliver yet, but they're right on Broadway near Columbus
and it couldn't be easier to get to.
We're looking forward to making Urban Curry a regular part of our take out routine.
lamb karahi.author: passion f.
lamb karahi.review:
my husband and i bought a ton of take out here using our groupon.  we got our favorite standard dishes:  Chicken Tikka for him, a Lamb Karahi and the Spinach w/ home made Cheese (palak paneer) for me.  
The staff could not have been nicer.  They told us to be seated at a table while we waited and sincerely offered to bring us waters.  The man who took our order was very specific when inquiring about our tolerances for heat and the cooks delivered a level that was perfect for us.
I'll admit that to me the Tikka tasted a bit like a sweet tomato soup, but my husband was over the moon with it and it's his regular dish.  i was thrilled with my Lamb dish, and it only tasted better when i revisited my left overs two days later.  The flavors had continued to develop while it sat in my fridge.
My whole wheat roti was perfect, perfect.  it was freshly made and had bubbly, crispy parts in it.  My man likes the Paratha, which i find a bit oily but he LOVED it.
Mostly, we're really excited to have good indian food in the neighborhood.  They don't deliver yet, but they're right on Broadway near Columbus and it couldn't be easier to get to.
We're looking forward to making Urban Curry a regular part of our take out routine.

excerpts: Prawn Karahi -
prawn karahi.author: David T.
prawn karahi.review:
Urban Curry is on one of my jogging routes. Every time I run past it, I've made a mental note to try it. Well this pile of mental notes has been accumulating, so it was time to catch up and try it.

Located on Broadway in the middle of the strip clubs, it doesn't score that well on decor or ambiance. 

The food however, scored much better. They have some Nepalese items that I don't usually encounter, which I really enjoyed. 

The staff were very friendly. Don't do takeout on a rainy day, unless you bring your own bags. They pack your to-go plastic containers in paper bags.

Note:  I really like spicy food, but I found MEDIUM is actually pretty hot on their spice scale. I think I will be a wimp and going with MILD here in future.

Tried the following:

Chicken MoMo - From the Authentic Nepali Specialties section of the menu. Won Ton like dumplings filled with minced curried chicken - outstandingly delicious.

Prawn Karahi - Not my favorite - Prawns were dry and appeared to be cooked separate from gravy and had little flavor.

Saag Paneer - very good.

Chicken Korma - very good

Goat Curry - Nepali home-style - good - nice goaty flavor.

Gulab jamun - very good - just the way I like it, sweet and not overly fragrant.

This is about 3.5 stars for me, but I will round up to 4.

excerpts: Best part was after being suggested the prawn karahi (house special with prawns, tomatoes and herbs).
I asked if it was healthy, the guy taking my order said it was, and he'd tell the cook to go light on the oil.
prawn karahi.author: Jason B.
prawn karahi.review:
Couldn't have been more pleased with the service. Friendly. Passionate about the food and purpose. Chai tea while you wait. Best part was after being suggested the prawn karahi (house special with prawns, tomatoes and herbs). I asked if it was healthy, the guy taking my order said it was, and he'd tell the cook to go light on the oil. Right on.

Wish I could be as effusive about the dish. Very good, just not a lot for $14. Think there were six or seven prawns, and the tails were still on. I really don't like that. Made for a mess getting them off.

So a soft three stars. You'll love the service. Maybe you'll love the food.

excerpts: My husband ordered the Chicken Tikka Kabab and I had the Paneer Makhani with Garlic naan.
I loved the food so much that I made it a point to let both the manager and chef know personally.
I also packed up leftovers to eat the next day.
Having been to many Indian restaurants here and in India...
I have to say this meal was one of the best!
The waitstaff was also very helpful and efficient.
5 out of 5!
chicken tikka kabab.author: S S.
chicken tikka kabab.review: Found the restaurant on Yelp while visiting San Francisco.  Upon entering we felt the ambience was average but the restaurant appeared clean and uncluttered.  The food was the shining star in our experience.  It was absolutely delicious! My husband ordered the Chicken Tikka Kabab and I had the Paneer Makhani with Garlic naan.  I loved the food so much that I made it a point to let both the manager and chef know personally.  I also packed up leftovers to eat the next day.  Having been to many Indian restaurants here and in India...I have to say this meal was one of the best! The waitstaff was also very helpful and efficient. 5 out of 5!

excerpts: We ordered mixed Fried rice with lassi which was awesome.. very fresh and lassi was not overloaded with sugar .
garlic
Naan was awesome too.oh and they have awesome chai
Their house speciality was little disappointing
but it's a nice place in the Heart of downtown.
mixed fried rice.author: Munch B.
mixed fried rice.review:
I am giving a 3 star cause some of their dishes were good but lacked ambience and neatness.
We ordered mixed Fried rice with lassi which was awesome.. very fresh and lassi was not overloaded with sugar . garlic Naan was awesome too.oh and they have awesome chai 
Their house speciality was little disappointing but it's a nice place in the Heart of downtown.

excerpts: Chicken chili & coconut chicken curry are delicious.
Absolutely delicious.
Naan was very fresh.

Momo is so so..see what I did there 
Will be back!
chicken chili.author: Tina H.
chicken chili.review:
Good service. Clean facility. 
Chicken chili & coconut chicken curry are delicious. Absolutely delicious.  
Naan was very fresh. 
Momo is so so..see what I did there 
Will be back!

excerpts: I love my usual dishes- of course chicken Tila masala, saag paneer, and other veggie dishes like alo gobi, but we love trying the Nepalese dinners too, like the Chicken Chili
chicken chili.author: Traci H.
chicken chili.review: Amazing food. They have all the things you'd expect of course at an Indian restaurant and more. The flavors are really multi-level and tasty. You can order them directly or through any of those delivery services or dine in. I've done all of the above. They will customize the spice, but be careful, medium is hot.... I love my usual dishes- of course chicken Tila masala, saag paneer, and other veggie dishes like alo gobi, but we love trying the Nepalese dinners too, like the Chicken Chili

excerpts: Needless to say, chicken momo, chicken chili and mango lassi have become a regular rotation in my diet.
Tasty food and the staff here is pretty attentive.
They were even nice enough to add a complimentary rice pudding dessert with my order the last time I went.
If youre looking for something different, in a good way, give these guys a shot.
chicken chili.author: Fernando C.
chicken chili.review: I was introduced to Nepalese food by my old coworker and she recommended this place.  Needless to say, chicken momo, chicken chili and mango lassi have become a regular rotation in my diet.  Tasty food and the staff here is pretty attentive. They were even nice enough to add a complimentary rice pudding dessert with my order the last time I went.  If youre looking for something different, in a good way, give these guys a shot.

excerpts: Chicken chili, paneer chili, manchurians, momos, hakka noodles.
This place is about as authentic as you can get for this kind of food.
And ridiculously cheap for the quality.
Must visit for people wanting to taste a different type of cuisine.
Would definitely go there again.
Seemed like they had the usual Indian dishes too, but I only tried the Indo-Chinese items.
Chai was very good too.
chicken chili.author: S P.
chicken chili.review:
Absolutely awesome place! During my childhood, I have had great Indo-Chinese/Nepalese food in India. Chicken chili, paneer chili, manchurians, momos, hakka noodles. This place is about as authentic as you can get for this kind of food. And ridiculously cheap for the quality. Must visit for people wanting to taste a different type of cuisine. Would definitely go there again. 
Seemed like they had the usual Indian dishes too, but I only tried the Indo-Chinese items. Chai was very good too.

excerpts: I did ask for extra mint chutney and no tamarind chutney, but they ended up giving me one of each.
Would have been better with two mint chutneys as one was only enough for one samosa.
And I didn't order curry or anything else to give it some moisture.
A coworker got the chicken tikka masala, extra spicy
and it was actually really hot.
tamarind chutney.author: Elena N.
tamarind chutney.review:
For part three of our weekly office lunch, I decided to get something from Urban Curry. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, July 6th around 12:30pm.

I ended up getting one of the Appetizers ($2.10) - Samosa: Fried pastry filled with potatoes and peas, Two pieces (+$3.15). The samosas were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I did ask for extra mint chutney and no tamarind chutney, but they ended up giving me one of each. Would have been better with two mint chutneys as one was only enough for one samosa. And I didn't order curry or anything else to give it some moisture. A coworker got the chicken tikka masala, extra spicy and it was actually really hot. So if you like heat, Urban Curry will deliver.

Price wise, I think this spot is a little expensive. $13.65 for chicken tikka masala is a little pricey in my opinion. I probably would have ordered my whole lunch from this spot if their price points were lower. Maybe that's the price you pay for being in North Beach? Based solely on my app, I'd say 3 stars.

Would have been better with two mint chutneys as one was only enough for one samosa.
And I didn't order curry or anything else to give it some moisture.
A coworker got the chicken tikka masala, extra spicy
and it was actually really hot.
